verse: The peopleâ€™s officials lived in Jerusalem, and the rest of the people cast lots to choose one out of every ten to live in Jerusalem, the holy city, while the other nine remained in their own cities.
The people blessed all those who volunteered to live in Jerusalem.
These are the descendants of Benjamin:
This is the information about the villages with their fields:
and in Jeshua, in Moladah, and in Beth Pelet,
and in Hazar Shual, and in Beersheba and its settlements,
and in Ziklag, and in Mekonah and in its settlements,
and in En Rimmon, and in Zorah, and in Jarmuth,
Zanoah and Adullam and their villages, Lachish and its fields, and Azekah and its settlements. So they settled from Beersheba to the Hinnom Valley.
Some of the descendants of Benjamin were from Geba, Mikmash, Aijah, and Bethel and its settlements,
Lod, and Ono, and the Valley of the Craftsmen.
Some of the Levite divisions of Judah were assigned to Benjamin.
